name: Palm Grove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from 7 days at Palm Grove and we had a brilliant time. The resort is located on what must be the best beach in Rarotonga -it is pristine with few people on the beach. The staff couldn't have been more helpful in settling us in (14 of us) and getting us set up with car and scooter rentals and giving us helpful hints of places to see and restaurants to dine at. Some of us stayed in the villa on the beach and it was very nice. What a great night we had on Good Friday - free drinks and great live music. Who the heck was Alice?
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only spent one night at the Palm Grove and were quite disappointed. Admittedly, we arrived on Good Friday (a holiday) but the reception was closed and the other staff were not helpful or welcoming. They couldn't assist with getting us enough towels or phone service or a quieter bungalow. Then at 4pm, the happy hour at the bar began. We were forced to listen to loud music for the next 5 hours. It would have been nice if they had warned us about this when we booked - especially as we were staying only the one night. Upon getting home, I have discovered they have double charged us for our stay - so yet another problem to sort out.
reviews.title: Not a great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: On a positive note, the bungalow was quite nicely laid out, was clean and the bed was comfortable. Just don't expect peace and quiet at this place.
reviews.title: Best beach on the island!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to everyone at Palm Grove for making our stay magical, especially Joanne for organising all the details for our wedding so we didn't have to think about a thing and we could just sit back and relax for the week before it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and service on the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room on the beach B1 was just perfect....our little piece of paradise with the water at our doorstep!
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six nights in a lovely beachfront bungalow and were really pleased we chose Palm Grove. We were in bungalow B8 which, although set back the furthest from the water than most of the others, seemed to get more sun on the balcony than many of the others, so we were really pleased to have found ourselves in that particular bungalow.
reviews.title: Amazing snorkling at your doorstep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We couldn't believe how fantastic the snorkling was within metres of stepping into the lagoon in front of our bungalow. Further travels around Rarotonga and Aitutaki confirmed just what a treat this particular beachfront is. There is, of course, good snorkling all around the Cooks, but right here was a highlight.
reviews.title: Paw Paw Lover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: I thought that the earlier review about the disappointing breakfast was very unfair. I had the exact opposite impression when I saw what I thought was a magnificent spread laid out for us on our first morning. I have fairly low expectations when I book accommodation with continental style breakfast, where toast and cereal are specified, but I was really pleased we were offered three different breads (multigrain for me, white for hubby), a generous slection of cereals (our next accommodation offered only corn flakes and rice bubbles, which I consider glorified cardboard, not food), and beautiful fresh fruit (and some tinned, but it bumped up the options, so who cares?). Not to mention yogurt and scones some days. Also, the spread options went beyond just the normal mini portions of jam, and offered jars of good quality jams and peanut butter as well.
reviews.title: a postcard from paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just come back from a wonderful holiday with my friend. We has a lovely stay with people (the staff) who make you feel like you are at home. The food was wonderful especially the Paw Paw juice. I have never been so relaxed in a long time. The pool may have not been available but the beautiful lagoon was, the beach was the best. If there was anything we needed we only had to ask and the staff were more than willing to help. A big thank you to the staff.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Thank you Betsy and all your lovely staff for making our eight days at Palm Grove unforgettable. You showed us generosity, kindness and thoughtfulness and nothing was too much trouble. Our villa, beside the lagoon, on the Island's best beach, couldn't have been better. Overall we had a fantastic holiday and highly recommend Palm Grove to anyone thinking of visiting the Cook Islands. It's the perfect place to stay. We felt it was home away from home and we'll be back.
reviews.title: If you choose here, make sure to pick the beach front rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We stayed a week at the beach villa with more family, 9 in total. The house is perfectly located to a stunning beach and just a boardwalk from the Yellow Hibiscus restaurant. We also used the pool everyday and hired scooters there - no need to bus into town to a rental shop. Loved it, we'll be back.
reviews.title: Best beach on Rarotonga plus everything else you need for a perfect holiday,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights in a beachfront bungalow. OMG totally stunning scenery. We checked out nearly every resort on rarotonga and although Palm Grove was simpler than some, it was set in one of the best locations and had a real welcoming and comfortable feel. The rooms were cleaned daily, the air con was great and they were clean and modern. Ours opened up to the most stunning beach and palm trees. We snorkels all over the island too. This is one of the best beaches to snorkel. You will not be disappointed at this place.
reviews.title: Stunning location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To Betsy & your staff - Stayed 11-21 Feb 2013, what I can say is this, thank you so much for an awesome stay. A relaxed atmosphere, accomodation with the pool literally outside our door,(which we utilised nearly everyday) and a fantastic view of the mountains when we opened our kitchen window.The locals (being four legged kind, feathered kind or the meow kind) they added colour to the place, even the rooster at times needed more choke to get himeself going in the morning.The views at the beach was fantastic, the grounds were tidy & your staff always had a smile and a greeting. To your driver (Nga) when ever he was around always had a tale or two to tell (What a character this guy is, always a laugh with him.). To your kitchen & bar staff (especially Mata) she was just fantatic the whole time, ensuring the the needs of eveyone was taken care of. Happy hour on Friday nights is a really relaxed meet & greet all the other guest atmosphere, I really enjoyed not having to move as the ladies kept topping up your drinks as the moved in between guest.(Cheers!). Sunday BBQ's, if you decide to stay or book for this on a Sunday, you have 2 choices, steak or fish. Beware if you order steak, I'm surprised there is no health warning for the size they serve, I believe that 500 grams of steak is more than ample for 1, let alone my wife, who struggled to eat her steak, so I ate 1/2 of her steak so I had about 750 grams almost a kilo of steak.( In my eyes, that is a side of beef). I could go on and on, but, there is no need. I would just like to reiterate once more thank you Betsy, Nga and especially Mata and the staff in the bar & kitchen who were absolutely fantastic. What I can say about Palm Grove is............AWESOME - a fantastic bunch of people you have there Betsy, I take my hat off to you and your staff. Guest @ G6
reviews.title: What can I say.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Palm Grove Jan 21 to 30. Very relaxed atmosphere, our garden accommodations were very nice, across from the pool. The small pool requires updating but was very refreshing on hot days. The Yellow Hibiscus restaurant serves good food, just not a lot of variety on the menu. Wigmore's store just 10 minutes walk down the road is handy for groceries, fruit, bottled water, and spirits. Free continental breakfast (8 to 10 am) was always good, with an assortment of fruit, cereals, juice, toast and coffee/tea. It always filled us till dinner which opens at 6 pm.
reviews.title: Lovely beach, relaxing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the staff at the resort are friendly and helpful. The roosters need new watches, as they start crowing sometimes as early as 3 am, not waiting till 6 am sunup. It's very handy and inexpensive to rent scooters at the resort, they are very handy to get around the island, especially on the back roads if you want to miss the traffic. The grounds are well kept. We did find a lot of mosquitoes since it was quite rainy during our stay, and even with bug dope, we didn't last long outside after dark. The area right behind the garden bungalows is a low wet area and was a good breeding ground for the mosquitoes.
reviews.title: Best beach, good snorkelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Palm Grove Resort Rarotonga in the Cook Islands would be one of the best locations on Rarotonga. The bungalow we had on the beach was fantastic, amazing sunsets, friendly locals and staff. Plenty to see and do. Just 5000klm from Sydney, 6 hour flight with Air New Zealand who do 2 flights direct to the cook islands, Fri and Sat.
reviews.title: Cook Islands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was great and the water was crystal clear.
reviews.title: Our favourite spot in the WORLD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Google, Palm Grove , Rarotonga and see for yourself. There other nice resorts but this one has the best beach front location. You must get a beach bungalow.you will not regret it.
reviews.title: Needs to think about their customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our 3rd stay at Palm Grove (4th to 14th March) and we would never consider staying anywhere elseon the island. The resort is gorgeous and would definately recommend staying in the beach front bungalows as they have the perfect view and are so private. Also the way they are decorated with the wall coverings makes you really feel like you are on a tropical island. The bed is so super comfortable and the shower pressure is better than what we have at home. All the staff are so lovely and friendly and we were also remembered and felt like rock stars when we arrived! Just down the road is an awesome restaurant called Vaimai which is so cool - you can walk along the beach (about 10 minutes) and the tables are on the beach - very romantic, excellent food and you cannot believe the sunsets. Don't even need to wear shoes. The food at the Yellow Hibiscus is really nice too and barbeque night (Sunday) is great and the salads are amazing. Eugene cooks a mean steak! Also Sunday and Tuesday they have a guy singing and he is excellent and needs to get signed up. We keep thinking we should go somewhere else for holidays and be a bit more adventurous (though we have travelled and lived overseas for many years) but when it comes time to book a trip we just can't keep away - Rarotonga is a beautiful place, the people are so happy and friendly and Palm Grove is the perfect example. We will be back!!!!
reviews.title: Awesome beachside bungalow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second trip to Rarotonga on Feb 2013 couldn't be dampened by the jaded and less than enthusiastic management and staff at Palm Grove. We travelled with our family to Rarotonga the week prior and stayed at Natura, a beautiful holiday house next door to Palm Grove. After the family left, we rolled our bags a couple of houses down and moved into B2. The room was the same as last year, and had a new bed and soft furnishings.
reviews.title: great place for relaxing holiday

description: Set in the enchanting area of Vaimaanga on the stunning southern coast, Palm Grove enjoys the tranquility of one of the best locations on Rarotonga. 26 individual bungalows are scattered over 5 acres of landscaped beachfront and garden property. Bungalows are available in studio to 3-bedroom layout and feature kingsize beds, kitchen facilities, aircon, flatscreen TV, and private patio/balcony. Property amenities include our onsite restaurant and bar, swimming pool, guest BBQ, laundry facility, tour desk, and motorbike rentals. All guests receive complimentary daily tropical breakfast buffet and use of kayaks, snorkel equipment, beach chairs and beach towels. Welcome to Palm Grove, your private piece of paradise!
